resources.string:
Start with your feet together and your arms by your sides,then jump up with your feet apart and your hands overhead.
Return to the starting position then do the next rep.This exercise provides a full-body workout and works all your large muscle

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your arms stretched forward. Then lift your upper body off the floor.
Hold for a few seconds and slowly return It primarily works the rectus abdominus muscle and the obliques

Lie on the floor with your toes and forearms on the ground.
Keep your body straight and hold this position as long as you can.

Lay prone on the ground with arms supporting your body. Keep your body straight while raising and lowering your body with your arms.
This exercise works the chest, shoulders, triceps, back and legs.

Stand in front of a chair. Then step up on the chair and step back down.
The exercise works to strengthen the legs and buttocks

Stand on the floor with your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
Move your arms forward in circles, and then move backwards.

For the start position, sit on the chair. Then move your hip off the chair with your hands holding the edge of the chair.
Slowly bend and stretch your arms to make your body go up and down. This is a great exercise for the triceps

Start in the push-up position. Bend your right knee towards your chest and keep your left leg straight, then quickly switch from one leg to other.
This exercise strengthens multiple muscle groups

Lie on your back with your hands behind your ears. Then lift your upper body off the floor and slowly up to the sitting position. Donâ€™t tug your neck when you get up.
If your spine hurts, please change to another workout.

Lie down on your back and put your hands beneath your hips for support. Then lift your legs up until they form a right angle with the floor.
Slowly bring your legs back down and repeat the exercise.

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, feet lifted a little bit and back tilted backwards.
Then hold your hands together and twist from side to side.

Lie face down, extend arms straight overhead, lift arms and legs off the ground, externally rotate arms in a sweeping motion, engage core muscles, maintain control, and repeat for desired repetitions.
Reverse snow angels target the back and core muscles, promoting improved posture and spinal alignment while strengthening the abdominal and lower back muscles.

Lie face down on the floor, extend your arms forward, simultaneously lift your arms and legs off the ground, hold for a few seconds.
while squeezing your glutes and engaging your back muscles, then lower back down and repeat for desired repetitions to strengthen your posterior chain and improve core stability.

Lie face down on the floor, extend your arms forward, simultaneously lift your arms and legs off the ground, hold for a few seconds while squeezing your glutes and engaging your back muscles, then lower back down and repeat for desired repetitions to strengthen your posterior chain and improve core stability.
First lift your right arm and the left leg as much as you can. And when you bring the two down, lift your left arm and your right leg. Do both these movements as fast as possible.

Stand straight up. Then step back with your left leg to the right and bend your knees at the same time.
Go back to the start position and switch to the other side.

Stand with your hands on your hips and feet a little wider than shoulder width apart. Then lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Your knees should be extended in the same direction as your tiptoes

Lie down on your side with your head rested on your right arm. Lift your upper leg up and return to the start position.
Make sure your left leg goes straight and down during the exercise it is a great exercise for the glutes.

Lie on your left side with your head resting on your left hand.
Then put your right foot forward on the floor. Lift your left leg up and down.

Start with your back against the wall, then slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
Keep your back against the wall with your hands and arms away from your legs. Hold the position. The exercise is to strengthen the quadriceps muscles.
